list.item: Clinical Intervention DescriptionPrimary cemented Total Knee Replacement (R)
Clinical Intervention DescriptionTransfusion of packed red blood cells, post-op

code.displayName: Transfusion of packed red blood cells, post-op

text.paragraph: Clinical SynopsisAdmitted for elective, right Total Knee Replacement (cemented prosthesis). Day 3, developed bilateral basal atelectasis. The FBC showed high WCC (20.0) and high neutrophils (16.0). Commenced on doxycycline and chest physio. Due to mild anaemia prior to surgery and subsequent operative blood loss, required a blood transfusion of three units. Subsequently made steady progress, regaining good mobility in his knee and is able to mobilise with the aid of a stick. Right knee Xray showed no fracture or dislocation, with the total knee prosthesis well positioned post surgery.

act.text: Admitted for elective, right Total Knee Replacement (cemented prosthesis). Day 3, developed bilateral basal atelectasis. The FBC showed high WCC (20.0) and high neutrophils (16.0). Commenced on doxycycline and chest physio. Due to mild anaemia prior to surgery and subsequent operative blood loss, required a blood transfusion of three units. Subsequently made steady progress, regaining good mobility in his knee and is able to mobilise with the aid of a stick. Right knee Xray showed no fracture or dislocation, with the total knee prosthesis well positioned post surgery.

list.caption: Item Detail
list.item: Dose Instruction1 tablet once daily oral

list.caption: Item Detail
list.item: Item DescriptionCodalgin Forte (paracetamol 500mg + codeine phosphate 30mg) tablet
Dose Instruction1-2 tablets as required oral. Max 8 per day

list.caption: Item Detail
list.item: Dose Instruction1 tablet once daily oral
Changes MadeDose decreased from 1 tablet Twice a day

list.caption: Item Detail
list.item: Dose Instruction1 tablet once daily oral
Additional CommentsPlease recommence 3 days after discharge

list.caption: Item Detail
list.item: Reason For ChangeCeased due to scheduled surgery

list.caption: Reaction Detail
list.item: Reaction DescriptionAcute exacerbation of chronic obstructive airways disease

code.displayName: Acute exacerbation of chronic obstructive airways disease
code.originalText: Acute exacerbation of chronic obstructive airways disease

list.caption: Alert
list.item: Alert DescriptionAt risk of pressure sores due to easily damaged skin

value.displayName: At risk of pressure sores due to easily damaged skin

list.caption: Requested Service
list.item: Service DescriptionOrthopaedic outpatient clinic appointment for 4 weeks post-discharge progress review

code.originalText: Orthopaedic outpatient clinic appointment for 4 weeks post-discharge progress review

code.codeSystemName: 1220.0 - ANZSCO - Australian and New Zealand Standard Classification of Occupations, First Edition, Revision 1

list.caption: Recommendations Provided
list.item: Supplementary Information NotePlease remove the staples on Nov 21 2010. Please ensure aspirin is recommenced 3 days post discharge. Please follow-up anaemia.

list.caption: Recommendations Provided
list.item: Supplementary Information NoteReturn to GP on Nov 21 2010 to have the staples removed. Keep up regular mobility routine as guided by physiotherapist. Please recommence aspirin 3 days post discharge.

list.caption: Information Provided
list.item: Supplementary Information NotePatient was given a brochure explaining the expected post-op recovery following a total knee replacement. The physiotherapist provided a list of home exercises. The good prognosis for return to activity was discussed with the patient – likely to be able to walk with a stick at six weeks.

act.text: Please remove the staples on Nov 21 2010. Please ensure aspirin is recommenced 3 days post discharge. Please follow-up anaemia.
